data.proxyObjectName: black insulated water bottle with Tesla logo
data.utilizationMethod: Grip the bottle around its narrow neck with the thumb on one side and 2–3 fingers on the opposite side. The neck’s ~3 cm diameter gives a rounded rod-like feel that approximates the mug’s handle, while the bottle’s filled mass and off-center weight create a similar downward torque when you lift, tilt, and set it down.

data.proxyObjectName: green and white plush turtle-shell cushion
data.utilizationMethod: Grasp the hard-sewn rim with both hands spaced apart. The large, soft dome supplies noticeable bulk and drag when you heave it downward, imitating the broad two-handed chopping motion and the deceleration thud of embedding an axe into wood.

data.proxyObjectName: white and gray camouflage wireless game controller
data.utilizationMethod: Hold the controller by one of its handgrips so the opposite weighted side extends forward like a mallet head. The plastic shell offers a rigid surface and the internal batteries concentrate weight toward the center, giving a moment of inertia that lags behind the wrist when you swing, effectively simulating hammer heft and follow-through.

data.proxyObjectName: black selfie stick with extendable metal rod and phone holder
data.utilizationMethod: Grip the padded handle as the sickle’s handle and leave the phone clamp folded so it forms a hook. With the rod partially extended, the telescoping section adds forward-weighted inertia, closely matching the swing feel when harvesting.
